parameters.name: HostAddress
parameters.description: The address of the host that you want to query. You can set this parameter to a domain name or an IP address. Only exact match is supported.

parameters.name: HostGroupId
parameters.description:
The ID of the host group to which the host to be queried belongs.

> You can call the [ListHostGroups](~~201307~~) operation to query the ID of the host group.

parameters.name: HostName
parameters.description: The name of the host that you want to query. Only exact match is supported.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description:
The ID of the bastion host on which you want to query hosts.

> You can call the [DescribeInstances](~~153281~~) operation to query the ID of the bastion host.

parameters.name: OSType
parameters.description:
The operating system of the host that you want to query. Valid values:

*   **Linux**
*   **Windows**

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: The number of the page to return. Default value: **1**.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description:
The number of entries to return on each page. Default value: **10**.

> We recommend that you do not leave this parameter empty.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the bastion host on which you want to query hosts.

> For more information about the mapping between region IDs and region names, see [Regions and zones](~~40654~~).

parameters.name: Source
parameters.description:
The source of the host that you want to query. Valid values:

*   **Local**: a host in a data center
*   **Ecs**: an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance
*   **Rds**: a host in an ApsaraDB MyBase dedicated cluster

parameters.name: SourceInstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the ECS instance or the host in an ApsaraDB MyBase dedicated cluster that you want to query. Only exact match is supported.

parameters.name: SourceInstanceState
parameters.description:
The status of the host that you want to query. Valid values:

*   **Normal**: normal
*   **Release**: released
